public class OAReflect
extends java.lang.Object

Used for Reflection services.

Author:
vincevia
See Also:
for storing "extra" properties and setting primitive properties to null., for getting "extra" properties and getting primitive properties as null.

getMethod

public static java.lang.reflect.Method getMethod(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                 java.lang.String methodName,
                                                 int paramCount)
Finds a Method in a class.

Parameters:
clazz - is the Class to use to find method name.
methodName - is case insensitive name of method.
Example: Employee.class, "getLastName")
Returns:
method in clazz that matches methodName.

getMethods

public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] getMethods(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                    java.lang.String propertyPath)
Get the methods for a property path.

Parameters:
clazz - beginning Class object to start with.
propertyPath - is dot "." separated list (case insensitive).
Example: getMethods(Order.class, "employee.department.region.name") will retrieve the following methods: Order.getEmployee(), Employee.getDepartment(), Department.getRegion(), Region.getName()

Note: if any of the propertyNames is a Hub, then it will use the Hub's activeObject when retreiving the property.

Returns:
array of "get' methods that can be used to retrieve a value from an object of type clazz.
Throws:
OAException - if any method can not be found.
See Also:
getPropertyValue(Object,Method), getMethods(Class,String,boolean)

getMethods

public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] getMethods(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                    java.lang.String propertyPath,
                                                    boolean bThrowException)
Get the methods for a property path.

Parameters:
clazz - beginning Class object to start with.
propertyPath - is dot "." separated list (case insensitive).
Example: getMethods(Order.class, "employee.department.region.name") will retrieve the following methods: Order.getEmployee(), Employee.getDepartment(), Department.getRegion(), Region.getName()

Note: if any of the propertyNames is a Hub, then it will use the Hub's activeObject when retreiving the property.

bThrowException - flag to know if an exception should be thrown if methods are not found.
Returns:
array of "get' methods that can be used to retrieve a value from an object of type clazz. If the a method can not be found then null is returned.
Throws:
OAException - if methods can not be found and bThrowException is true. also can use newer OAPropertyPath, which has more info, including the methods
See Also:
getPropertyValue(Object,Method)

convertParameterFromString

public static java.lang.Object convertParameterFromString(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                                          java.lang.String value)
Convert String to required object needed as a parameter to Method. This will call OAConverter to do the conversion.

Parameters:
method - is Method that value will be sent to.
value - is String that needs to be converted so that it can be used with method.
Returns:
Object that is converted from String value.
See Also:
OAConverter

                                                          java.lang.String value,
                                                          java.lang.String format)

Parameters:
method - is Method that value will be sent to.
value - is String that needs to be converted so that it can be used with method.
format - is text format used for String.
Returns:
Object that is converted from String value.
See Also:
OAConverter

getPropertyValueAsString

public static java.lang.String getPropertyValueAsString(java.lang.Object object,
                                                        java.lang.reflect.Method[] method)
Convert the returned object to a String value.

Parameters:
object - beginning object to use when calling methods.
method - array of methods to call. Will use object for the first method, then will follow using the returned object for each method.
Returns:
If any method call returns a null, then null will be returned, else the string value of the last method call.
See Also:
getMethods(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String), getPropertyValue(java.lang.Object, java.lang.reflect.Method[])

getPropertyValueAsString

public static java.lang.String getPropertyValueAsString(java.lang.Object object,
                                                        java.lang.reflect.Method[] method,
                                                        java.lang.String format)
Convert the returned object, from an array of method calls, to a String value.

Parameters:
object - beginning object to use when calling methods.
method - array of methods to call. Will use object for the first method, then will follow using the returned object for each method.
format - text format to use for conversion to string value.
Returns:
If any method call returns a null, then null will be returned, else the string value of the last method call.
See Also:
getMethods(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String), getPropertyValue(java.lang.Object, java.lang.reflect.Method[])

Parameters:
object - beginning object to use when calling methods.
method - array of methods to call. Will use object for the first method, then will follow using the returned object for each method.
format - text format to use for conversion to string value.
Returns:

if null then "", else formated string, using OAConverter.toString(value, format)

getClasses

public static java.lang.String[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName)
                                     throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                            java.io.IOException
Get name of all classes in a package. Example: String[] cs = getClasses("com.viaoa.scheduler.oa"); output: Item SalesOrder Customer etc ...

Parameters:
packageName -
Returns:
String array of class names, without the package prefix or '.class' suffix.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
